title: Without an unbalanced force acting on it, what will a moving object do? - Quora

response.answer_text: Move at a constant speed in a straight line. This means the velocity vector is unchanging. A special case is a when the velocity vector has a zero length - the state of rest.
EVERY moving object will keep on gettin’ on, in a straight line at constant speed (unless an unbalanced force acs on it).
